div.div: Ἴ̄φιτος (ϝιφ.): Iphitus.—(1) son of Eurytus, an Argonaut, guest-friend of Odysseus, slain by Heracles, Od. 21.14-37. —(2) son of Nautolus, an Argonaut, from Phocis, father of Schedius and Epistrophus, Il. 2.518, Il. 17.306.—(3) father of Archeptolemus.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
